summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Syria, reaffirms its commitment to Syria's sovereignty, independence, unity, and territorial integrity.

Endorses the Joint Statement of the US and Russian Federation on Cessation of Hostilities in Syria, effective 27 February 2016.

Demands:

* Full and immediate implementation of resolution 2254 (2015) for a Syrian-led and Syrian-owned political transition.
* All parties to the cessation of hostilities to fulfil their commitments.
* Humanitarian agencies' rapid, safe, and unhindered access throughout Syria.

Supports:

* ISSG initiative to accelerate humanitarian aid delivery.
* Syrian-led political process facilitated by the UN.

Requests:

* Secretary-General to report on implementation of this resolution and resolution 2254 (2015) within 15 days and every 30 days thereafter.

Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
